tuv.seg: Members of the Oireachtas (TDs and Senators) enjoy certain constitutional privileges
Tá pribhléidí áirithe bunreachtúla ag an Oireachtas (Teachtaí Dála agus Seanadóirí) in Éirinn
This means that they have certain rights and privileges that are set down by Bunreacht na hÉireann (the Irish Constitution)
Ciallaíonn seo go bhfuil cearta agus pribhléidí áirithe acu atá leagtha síos ag Bunreacht na hÉireann
• TDs and Senators may not, for example, be arrested when going to, returning from or being within the precincts of either the Dáil or Seanad

• Ní ceadmhach, mar shampla, Teachtaí Dála ná Seanadóirí a ghabháil le linn dóibh a bheith ag dul chuig aon cheann den Dáil nó an Seanad) ag filleadh uathu nó le linn dóibh a bheith laistigh de phurláin ceachtar den dá Theach
This privilege does not apply to arrest for treason, felony or breach of the peace
Níl feidhm leis an bpribhléid sin i gcás gabhála de bharr tréasa, feileonachta ná briseadh síochána
• TDs and Senators may not be sued for defamation because of any speech in the House
• Ní féidir dlí a agairt ar Theachtaí Dála ná ar Sheanadóirí de bharr aon óráide sa Teach
This privilege protects members both in the House and at Committee hearings
Tugann an phribhléid seo cosaint do bhaill sa Teach agus ag éisteachtaí Coistí araon
If a member of either House acts in a way that amounts to an abuse of a privilege, the Committee on Procedures and Privileges may recommend disciplining the member
Má ghníomhaíonn ball cheachtar den dá Theach ar bhealach arb ionann é agus mí-úsáid pribhléide, is féidir leis An Coiste um Nós Imeachta agus Pribhléidí moladh a dhéanamh an ball a chur faoi smach
